sentences.en: Bellicose: Warlike in manner or temperament; pugnacious.
sentences.cn: 好战的: 在行为方式或性格上好战的; 好斗的.

sentences.en: China, of course, insists it has bellicose intentions.
sentences.cn: 当然, 中国坚称自己绝无好战意图.

sentences.en: Faber had imagined them to be young, fit , aggressive and bellicose as well as clever.
sentences.cn: 在费伯的想象中,他们都是年富力强, 逞能好斗,聪明伶俐的人.

sentences.en: His bellicose disposition alienated his friend.
sentences.cn: 他生性好斗,他的朋友们都疏远了他.

sentences.en: I remind myself that the war in Iraq started with bellicose posturing and photographs.
sentences.cn: 我提醒自己,伊拉克战争始于好斗的姿态和照片.

sentences.en: Less bellicose but equally specific definitions are now in force in Britain.
sentences.cn: 缺乏攻击性但是同样有特定含义的措施正在英国执行中.

sentences.en: Some irresponsible politicians made a bellicose remarks.
sentences.cn: 一些不负责任的政客做出一些好战的话语.

sentences.en: The Chinese are being very bellicose about this.
sentences.cn: 中国对此有很激烈反应.

sentences.en: The result of being bellicose is that all your previous efforts become wasted.
sentences.cn: 恋战的后果就是前功尽弃.
